main event: An unidentified aerial object was observed multiple times on May 3, 1949 in Los Alamos, New Mexico. The object appeared as a white light, similar in size to an aircraft landing light, and was sighted by AEC security inspectors and other observers.
interesting points: The object was seen at different times between 2113 and 2205, each time appearing for 3-7 seconds and moving very fast.
It was observed to have a very bright white light, with no sound or odor associated with it.
On the second sighting, the object appeared to hover in one place for approximately 3 seconds before moving north.
The sighting occurred during the Aquarid meteor shower, which reaches its maximum on May 4th. This context raises questions about a potential astronomical explanation for the observations.
Multiple security inspectors from the AEC were involved as observers, adding credibility to the report.
witnesses: AEC security inspectors and other observers
